Ad Text:
Permanent role
Open to Sydney, Brisbane and Melbourne office locations with hybrid working
Use data to drive commercial decision making in eCommerce at Woolworths




We strive to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow for our customers and team, ¬†bringing the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium together to make data driven decisions. By partnering with Quantium, a world-class data science and advanced analytics business we‚Äôre excited about the future as we unlock the power of data to reimagine retail.

¬†

Through this partnership, we‚Äôve created a new business called wiq who will harness the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium to reimagine retail by solving the most complex problems using data and analytics. As a team, we leverage Agile ways of working to help our team develop their skills while also making sure our team is focusing on solving the most complex problems for both our customers and team.




What you‚Äôll do

The role of the Senior Insights Analyst within the Food eCom Business Unit is to measure, track, and optimise performance of digital assets & customer behaviour across the eCommerce business. Partnering with teams across Food eCom, you will be delivering data-driven insights related to the performance of digital assets, promotions and merchandising, as well as customer behaviour on web and app.




Provide insights to inform strategic decision making by analysing various commercial lenses in both digital and offline platforms
Build reports and customised data models/dashboards to track & evaluate performance of digital merchandising and promotional activities such campaigns & promotions, proof of concepts (POC), and more
Work across multiple systems in content management, financial reporting, & BI
Collaborate with BI team on dashboard requirements, use cases, and designs
Prioritise and respond to ad-hoc analytical requests from internal stakeholders
Be an advocate of analytics and collaborate within the Digital Trade & Commercial Insights CoE to promote knowledge sharing







What you‚Äôll bring

We are looking for an experienced, commercially minded Senior Insights Analyst who is comfortable working in complex, multi-stakeholder environments.




5+ years experience in an Analyst role
Strong data visualisation and communication skills (both written & verbal)
Strong SQL, data analysis, and modelling skills¬†
Experience with BigQuery, Tableau, and Looker Studio highly desirable
Able to synthesise large amounts of data from a variety of sources
A self-starter ‚Äì able to work with minimal supervision, able to deal with ambiguity, and self-motivated
Challenges the status quo and existing assumptions in order to promote innovative thinking and new solutions
Adaptable, collaborative, high attention to detail, improvement orientated




If you meet a number of requirements (and not all), we encourage you to submit your application.




What you‚Äôll experience

Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we‚Äôre always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work:

Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work.
A global business with endless career possibilities around every corner and across every discipline ‚Äì with valuable exposure to a vast and exciting business network.
High impact role supporting our teams who enrich our communities.¬†
A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app.
A progressive and competitive leave policy that gives you more space for what matters to you. ¬†




Everyone Belongs at Woolworths Group

Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team‚Äôs diversity brings to our business, customers, and communities and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.

We encourage all candidates to apply; please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.

Company: Talent ‚Äì Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Talent International is currently recruiting for a Senior People Insights Analyst, based in Kensington. This position is a contract role for 4 months initially, with the view to be extended and pays an hourly rate of $70 to $75 per hour + Super.

7 hours a day / 35 hours per week

You'll play a critical role in designing and delivering reporting frameworks, dashboards, and workforce insights that enable data-driven decisions across People & Culture (P&C). This is a hands-on role requiring advanced analytics skills and the ability to translate data into meaningful business outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:

Extract and analyse people data using SQL and PeopleSoft.
Develop and maintain dashboards/reports to ensure compliance with legislation, policies, and enterprise agreements.
Partner with stakeholders to translate business requirements into actionable insights.
Deliver analytics and workforce trends that inform strategic decision-making.
Provide documentation, mentoring, and support to enhance reporting capability across P&C.
Ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance.

About You:

Strong experience in Advanced SQL, PeopleSoft experience - main HRIS, and data visualisation tools (Power BI preferred).
Skilled in designing and implementing reporting frameworks in complex organisations.
Proven ability to translate data into strategic workforce insights.
Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to engage technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with Databricks and Azure DevOps (desirable).
Strong problem-solving, documentation, and project coordination skills.

What's in it for you?

Work with a prestigious university in a pivotal analytics role.
Contribute to workforce strategy and data transformation initiatives.
Hybrid working flexibility (Kensington office + WFH).
Contract with the potential to extend.

If you're a data-driven professional with strong PeopleSoft and SQL expertise, we'd love to hear from you.

If you are interested in this role, please APPLY NOW by submitting your resume in MS Word Format. For further information, you may contact Uvez Ahmed on 02 8240 9596 / uvez.ahmed@talentinternational.com for a confidential discussion.

Closing Date: 9 am Monday, 1 September¬†
face2face reference: 648889
Locations: Richmond or Geelong VIC, Surry Hills NSW, Deakin ACT¬†
Contract Duration: 12 months + Potential extension/s


Why Join?

Contribute to shaping fair and sustainable pricing and policy outcomes
Apply your analytical skills to support evidence-based decision-making
Work on complex economic, market, and expenditure monitoring challenges
Be part of a collaborative team delivering high-impact insights
Develop innovative data solutions and reporting tools
Grow your expertise in statistical modelling and data analytics

About the Role

As part of a specialist data and reporting team, you will deliver analysis, reporting, and data management to support policy development and market monitoring. This role plays a key part in examining trends, identifying insights, and contributing to high-profile publications that inform decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

Design, build and deploy scalable statistical and data models
Develop and deliver regular and ad hoc reports, insights, and visualisations
Maintain and enhance performance dashboards and data reporting tools
Collect, analyse and present complex data to support policy outcomes
Identify, explore and formalise data insights, including third-party data integration
Engage with stakeholders to deliver data projects and contribute to forums

Skills & Experience

Strong analytical mindset with the ability to work with large datasets
Proficiency in statistical software such as R, Python, Excel, SAS or SQL
Experience in data manipulation, extraction, and modelling
Ability to synthesise complex information and present insights clearly
Strong collaboration and stakeholder engagement skills
Capacity to work independently as well as part of a team

Australian Citizenship is a mandatory requirement for this position.¬†

If you have any questions or would like more details, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to Urvish Kahar at urvish.kahar@f2frecruitment.com.au.

Senior Technical Business Analyst

Newly created role to support integral business function¬†

Have an impact on how we shop as a nation¬†

Work with the brightest minds to drive innovation¬†




We are Woolworths Group

We are Woolworths Group. 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives connected by a shared Purpose ‚Äì ‚Äòto create better experiences together for a better tomorrow. It‚Äôs that Purpose that fuels our ambition to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week.

If you‚Äôre excited to turn today‚Äôs blue sky thinking into a better tomorrow for future generations, you‚Äôll find yourself supported and enriched in a dynamic, inclusive and empowering workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve. With a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and opportunities across the group to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.




What you'll do

As the Senior Technical Business Analyst, you will lead the analysis and definition of complex technical solutions that align with strategic business objectives. Work to drive collaboration across multiple teams, business units, and vendors, ensuring the alignment of requirements and successful delivery of large-scale digital products and services.¬†




Elicit and Document Business and Technical ¬†Requirements: Lead complex workshops, interviews, and other discovery activities to gather and document comprehensive business requirements, user needs, and functional and non-functional specifications for major projects.

Analyse Business Processes: Analyse existing business processes, identify pain points, and recommend improvements to streamline operations and enhance efficiency.

Drive Solution Design: Take ownership in collaborating with cross-functional teams, including UX/UI designers, developers, and product managers, to lead the design of complex technical solutions that align with business strategies and ensure designs meet strategic business requirements and user needs.

Support Testing & Implementation: Support the testing and implementation of clear acceptance criteria, in collaboration with Quality Engineers to ensure effective and high quality delivery

Data Analysis and Reporting: Drive data-informed product and technology decisions by working with Product and Business stakeholders, leading complex data analysis and providing strategic insights.

Backlog Prioritisation and Grooming: Work with business and product stakeholders to ensure a healthy backlog. A healthy backlog is a prioritised set of stories with enough detail for technology teams to execute at any point in time. In addition to creation of User Stories & Acceptance Criteria: Translate technical requirements into detailed technical user stories and acceptance criteria, including performance and security considerations.




What you‚Äôll bring

Possessing 5+ years of demonstrable Business Analyst experience, preferably within a digital or technology-focused setting. You will demonstrate the below:¬†

Proven experience working with Agile methodologies.

Experience working with a cross functional set of stakeholders including Product, Business, Engineering and Delivery.¬†

Experience with database management systems (e.g., SQL, Oracle)

Strong collaboration and communication skills and ability to build strong business relationships

Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field.




What You‚Äôll Experience

We embrace diversity of thought and love to take on challenges with a pragmatic and innovative approach. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. We continually seek ways to pair, collaborate, support, and learn from each other as a team!

Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work.

A global business with endless career possibilities around every corner and across every discipline ‚Äì with valuable exposure to a vast and exciting business network.

A progressive and flexible ‚Äòwork from anywhere' policy that gives you the opportunity to harmonise work, life and your wellbeing.

A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app.

Senior Commercial Strategy Analyst

Churches of Christ

Kenmore, QLD¬†| Full-Time | | Hybrid Work Options Available (First 4 weeks in office)

¬†

Are you a strategic thinker with a sharp analytical mind and a passion for driving commercial performance?

Churches of Christ is seeking a¬†Senior Commercial Strategy Analyst¬†to join our Finance team and play a pivotal role in shaping the organisation‚Äôs strategic direction.

The Senior Commercial Strategy Analyst plays a critical role in driving strategic decision-making and commercial performance across the organisation. This role is responsible for delivering high-impact financial and strategic analysis, supporting investment decisions, and identifying opportunities for growth and efficiency. The analyst will work closely with senior leadership, finance, operations, and other key stakeholders to provide insights that shape the company‚Äôs strategic direction.

What you will be doing:

Support the annual strategy refresh process, ensuring alignment with organisational goals and market dynamics.
Conduct environmental scans, competitor benchmarking, and internal performance reviews to inform strategic priorities.
Support and collaborate with senior leaders to shape strategic direction and investment / divestment priorities.
Translate strategic objectives into actionable business plans, including timelines, resource requirements, and measurable outcomes.
Partner with business units to ensure alignment between strategy and operational execution.
Monitor progress against strategic initiatives and escalate risks or barriers to execution.
Develop and maintain¬†KPI dashboards¬†and performance scorecards to track progress against strategic and financial goals.
Support monthly and quarterly reporting cycles with clear, data-driven commentary and recommendations.
Lead or support the development of robust¬†business cases¬†for new initiatives, capital investments, and strategic projects.
Ensure business cases include financial modelling, risk assessments, and alignment with strategic objectives.
Build and maintain complex¬†financial models¬†to evaluate investment opportunities, scenario planning, and sensitivity analysis.
Provide commercial insights and recommendations based on financial outcomes and market trends.
Support pricing strategies, cost-benefit analysis, and margin improvement initiatives.
Own and continuously improve the organisation‚Äôs¬†investment evaluation framework, ensuring consistency, transparency, and alignment with strategic goals.
Provide guidance and training to stakeholders on investment governance, evaluation criteria, and post-implementation reviews.
Ensure all investment proposals meet internal standards and regulatory requirements.

About You and what you will bring:

Degree in Finance or related field (CA/CPA desirable)
5+ years‚Äô experience in commercial strategy, financial analysis, or consulting
Advanced Excel and Power BI skills with strong financial modelling capability
Proven ability to influence senior stakeholders and communicate complex insights
Experience in aged care, healthcare, or property investment sectors is a plus
Strong leadership, problem-solving, and project management skills

¬†

Why Join Churches of Christ?

Make a meaningful impact in a purpose-driven organisation
Work with a collaborative, values-led team
Enjoy generous salary packaging benefits up to¬†$18,549 p.a.
Access¬†five weeks annual leave, EAP, and exclusive discounts
Be part of a culture that values innovation, integrity, and continuous improvement


üåê¬†Apply now¬†or visit¬†www.cofc.com.au¬†to learn more.


We warmly welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.


Applications will be reviewed as received ‚Äì don‚Äôt wait to apply!

Full time permanent position | Sydney CBD
Analyse risk across diverse global energy trading portfolios
Sydney based

Join a team that's All Kinds of Useful

At Origin, being useful is more than a tagline - it's how we approach work every day. As a collective, we're a team that thrives on finding better ways, working together, and owning our impact. From powering homes to delivering award-winning internet and helping to lead Australia's energy transition. If you're driven by purpose and excited to be part of something bigger, we'd love to have you on the journey.

About the role:



Reporting to the Risk Reporting Manager, Financial Risk, this is a pivotal role that will analyse risks within Origin's commodity trading portfolios including Oil, LNG, Gas and Coal.

Key Responsibilities:

Support the development of tools and analytical models to provide insights into the energy commodity landscape and Origin's market exposures.
Manage the operation of key risk models, including data sourcing, validation, and reconciliation of model inputs and outputs.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure accurate and timely risk reporting, fostering strong working relationships across teams.
Communicate market developments and trading position changes across the commodity portfolio in a clear and effective manner.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of risk models, methodologies, and assumptions, and assist with the coordination and administration of risk committee activities.

What will you bring:

A proactive approach to learning and developing relationships. Tertiary qualifications in a economics, mathematics or related discipline (CFA). In addition, you'll possess:

Experience in energy derivatives and commodity markets.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
Advanced Excel skills; experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau.
High attention to detail, particularly in data validation and reconciliation.
Solid understanding of quantitative finance concepts, including Value at Risk (VaR) and option pricing.
Proficiency in programming and data tools such as VBA, SQL, and Python.

So, why join us?

Discounted Origin products benefits for employees, including Electrical, Gas and Internet offers!
Hybrid working environment, opportunity to connect with your team in our CBD office.
Competitive salary + annual performance bonus + performance based reviews.
Origin 360 Electric Vehicles (EV) employee subscription offers a fantastic range of EVs, with flexible month-to-month plans and no lock-in contract.
Free and confidential counselling for employees and family members.
A great high energy team, that encourages interesting, rewarding, and engaging work!

Origin - Where good change happens

At Origin, we're powered by people who believe in creating change.


We are committed to fostering a diverse, gender equitable workforce, where everyone is welcome, and all applications are evaluated on merit and potential. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, people living with disabilities, culturally diverse people, any stage in life, people with intersex variations and people within LGBTQ+ communities, including trans and gender diverse.


Enjoy a challenging career in an exciting industry where you can grow and explore your potential. If you think you have transferable skills, an appetite to learn and would be a great fit, we'd love to hear from you.


Here's a little about us: https://www.originenergy.com.au/about/careers/

Background checks may be required to determine your suitability for this position as part of the recruitment process and during your employment. These checks may include police checks, AusCheck, medical assessment and/or drug and alcohol testing.

Please note unsolicited CVs from agencies will not be accepted.

Origin recognises Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples as the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia, and we pay our respects to Elders past, present and future.

Job Title: Principal Business Analyst - Property Data Asset Valuation Business Analyst
Ad Text:
$1,000 to $1,176 per day;
Initial 6 Months Contract with potential of renewal;
WFH Hybrid;
Large End-user Organization;
High profile project
Great Team to work with;

Our client a large NSW government organisation is seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst with deep expertise in property data and valuation to join a high-profile project that is shaping the future of property information services.
¬†¬†
You will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business stakeholders, technical teams, and data specialists‚Äîensuring solutions meet industry standards for accuracy, compliance, and usability.
¬†¬†
Must Have skills:

Proven background in property data analysis, valuation processes, and market data interpretation.
Strong experience as a Business Analyst in complex data-driven projects.
Understanding of property data models, geospatial concepts, and valuation workflows.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and facilitation skills.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Ability to work on weekend / after hours on occasion.
Desirable skills:

Experience within NSW government organisations;
Experience with Pega workflow automation or similar BPM/workflow systems (e.g., Appian, IBM BPM).
Knowledge of databases (SQL) and ability to query, analyse, and validate datasets.
Exposure to spatial data systems, GIS tools, or property data platforms.
Demonstrated understanding of Oracle / Azure databases

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with business units to understand needs, gather information, and analyse requirements, producing Needs Analysis documents that clearly define issues, proposed improvements, and expected benefits for the spatially enabled workflow platform (Valnet III).
Engage with stakeholders to review current operations and workflows, creating process and information models to identify and prioritise opportunities for improvement.
Lead the creation and documentation of business requirements in line with agreed methodologies, policies, standards, and architectures, securing formal stakeholder approval.
Prepare business cases and support the development of High-Level and Detailed Requirements Specifications to guide the design and delivery of solutions that achieve targeted business benefits.
Contribute to testing activities by developing test strategies, plans, and scripts, and assisting with IT test execution to ensure solutions meet requirements.
Analyse issues and stakeholder feedback to produce actionable insights and recommendations that improve services in alignment with business strategy and user needs.
Ensure high-quality analysis and documentation to provide a robust foundation for future system enhancements and operations.
Best method to apply is using the application button on this advert. We can be¬†contacted on (02) 9687 1025 for a confidential discussion but please ensure the resume has been sent.


Please ensure all documents are sent in Microsoft word format.

Commercial Analyst - Energy markets

Vinova are working with a leading organisation in Australia to hire a Commercial Analyst who blends energy-market analytics with sharp financial modelling. You'll help shape investment decisions, M&A, and commercial strategy across large-scale renewable and transmission projects.

The opportunity

You will be joining a business in a critical growth period where you will be able to get involved in work across all of the energy markets team support strategy, transactions, and investment cases for utility-scale solar, BESS, Wind and Transmission. You will also translate complex technical and financial analysis into clear recommendations for senior stakeholders and investment committees.

What you'll do

Build and maintain advanced project finance models to assess feasibility, valuation, and financing options.
Analyse energy market data (wholesale price forecasts, dispatch curves, forward pricing) to inform revenue forecasts and optimise structures.
Contribute to M&A processes: due diligence, valuation, and commercial strategy.
Draft business cases and investment papers with crisp insights and options.
Provide commercial input to bids, tenders, and offtake negotiations to ensure bankability and competitiveness.
Work closely with development, finance, and market teams to align commercial and delivery outcomes.

What you'll bring

3+ years experience working across energy market roles
Experience with financial modelling skills across project finance, feasibility analysis, and valuation.
Strong grasp of energy market dynamics, offtake structures, and revenue modelling.
M&A exposure with due diligence and transaction execution experience.
Strong understanding of the Australian energy market and NEM.

Why join our client

Direct impact on some of Australia's most significant renewable and infrastructure projects.
High visibility to decision makers and the chance to influence portfolio strategy.
Collaborative team with a mission-driven focus on the energy transition.

Next steps


If this sounds like you, please apply below and I will get back to you as soon as possible.

Mirvac is a brand that creates and curates better experiences. We are more than developers or builders - we are visionaries, and our ability to see the world differently drives us to be bold, embrace innovation and diversity, and lead with optimism.

As creators of positive change, we see each new project as an opportunity to leave a lasting legacy, delivering enduring value for all Australians. We focus on sustainability, innovation, and shared value, to return benefits to our customers, partners, investors, and communities.

Join us as we work towards building the imagine nation.

Our opportunity

As Research Analyst, you will provide high quality insights of market performance, risks and return drivers for the Group and external clients. Produce analytics & insights spanning economic, demographic, capital market and property spheres for a variety of internal and external clients.

Your responsibilities will include:


Play an integral role in the Group Research team while liaising with business stakeholders from various divisions including Investments, Funds Management, Asset Management, Development, Investor Relations, and Corporate Services on requirements
Build expertise on property return drivers and become a strong internal point of contact for market intelligence
Learn the variety of key macro-economic and real estate data sources including key splits & segmentations that underpin investment performance
Create and supply senior business stakeholders with visual storytelling analytics via charting software
Problem-solve by transforming granular datasets, internal intelligence and external contacts into relevant insights for business teams
Play a central role in execution of regular external client reporting products as well as ad-hoc requirements
Collect, update and maintain sector workbooks, outlook packs, forecast models and chart decks
Produce quarterly commentary on sectors for internal and external clients and attend presentations with Head of Research and team members
Work with New Business teams and Strategy teams on content for Group and Division strategy plus project feasibility assumptions, capital partnering initiatives & Investment Committee paper input etc

Your point of difference

You will be professionally qualified in Business/Finance, Economics Property Economics with experience translating data into relevant business insights. You will have a strong understanding of Real Estate and/or Investments as well as macroeconomic, capital market, demographic and regulatory concepts and how they impact real estate.

You will have confidence to present at meetings, and have clear, concise writing and presentation skills with demonstrated experience in tailoring output to various audiences.

All of these qualities are preferred, if you think you may be the right fit for the role please still apply.
